item.title: How I build software quickly
item.description: Know how good your code needs to be for the task at hand. Start with a rough draft. Try to soften requirements if you can. Don't get distracted. Make small changes. Practice specific skills.

item.title: Apple’s Browser Engine Ban Persists, Even Under the DMA - Open Web Advocacy
item.description: TL;DR: Apple’s rules and technical restrictions are blocking other browser vendors from successfully offering their own engines to users in the EU. At the recent Digital Markets Act (DMA) workshop, Apple claimed it didn’t know why no browser vendor has ported their engine to iOS over the past 15 months. But the reality is Apple knows exactly what the barriers are, and has chosen not to remove them.

item.description: Quite often I hear the complaint that WinUI, and thus Uno Platform, doesn’t include validation. There was some evidence a while ago that it was being worked on by the WinUI team (ie commented out validation XAML in the WinUI styles), but there doesn’t seem to be any more progress in this area, despite a ... item.title: mkcd: The missing shell shortcut
item.description: The command 'mkdir' is often followed by 'cd' to the same directory, suggesting 'mkcd'. I analyze my usage, look for the origin of 'mkcd', and implement it for fish.

item.title: Using Signal groups for activism
item.description: Things are heating up. Millions of people are taking to the streets against Trump's rising authoritarianism. item.title: Stop Using MVVM - Nick's .NET Travels
item.description: The Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) pattern has long been a cornerstone in building maintainable and testable UIs across frameworks like WPF, Xamarin, Uno Platform, and others. It provides a clean separation of concerns and enables powerful data binding. But despite its popularity and maturity, MVVM often introduces unnecessary complexity and friction—particularly when it comes to state management ... Read more

item.title: Reading Neuromancer for the very first time in 2025
item.description: So many sci-fi movies, anime, and video games owe a massive debt of gratitude to William Gibson's seminal 1984 novel.
